title: Journal of a tour through the Highlands of Scotland during the summer of MDCCCXXIX.
author: Botfield, Beriah
snippet: The Roman Camelon is now chiefly occupied by the colliers of Carron ; nor did any thingoccur more striking than the church of Larbert, anew Gothic erection, tiU we entered the Torwood,a large coUection of fine young oaks, intermixedwith more venerable forest trees, a remnant ofthe vast forest, yclept Caledonian, which oncecovered nearly the whole of Scotland.

title: Lucy, Francis and Cousin Bill. A novel, etc
author: Wistan, Aden.
snippet: Sheleft by the first train after breakfast, going byLarbert, having resolved not to take the route bywhich she had come.

title: Gray Days and Gold ... New edition, revised, with illustrations
author: Winter, William
snippet: Carron River, with its tiny but soundingcataract, is presently passed, and at Larbert your glancerests lovingly upon " the little gray church on the windyhill."

title: Journal of a Summer Tour in the Perthshire and Inverness-shire Highlands
author: Roger, James Cruikshank.
snippet: Set out for Edinburgh at 12.45, via Larbert, andreached the northern capital a few minutes aftertwo o'clock.

title: Travels in Lands beyond the Sea. Beauty and Glory of Western Europe, etc
author: Linskill, Charles D.
snippet: We pass Bannockburn, Larbert, Green Hill, Cumberland, Glenboig, Cartcosh,Cænkirk and Steps Road.

title: Recollections of a Visit to Glasgow with the British Archæological Associations, August 27th to September 5th, 1888. With notes
author: Lambert, George
snippet: The party left shortly afternine o'clock, by train, for Larbert, where they visited thechurchyard, in which lies the body of Bruce, the AbyssinanTraveller, born in 1730, who died from an accident at his owndoor at Kinnaird, helping a lady into her carriage, 1794, andthence drove to Tor wood.

title: A Voyage round Great Britain; with short views of Aberdeen, Balmoral, ... Fécamp, Havre and Paris
author: Hargreaves, Thomas
snippet: Changing trains at Larbert, I duly arrived in Stirlingat 5.15, and took up my quarters at the Star Hotel.
